New Records: Gerrit Cole gave up seven runs, his most since June 9, 2022.
Cole hit a career-high three batters.
Key Match Events: Rafael Devers’ intentional walk by Gerrit Cole with no runners one on sparks Red Sox over Yankees 7-1
Devers added a two-run single in Boston’s four-run fifth as the Red Sox beat the New York Yankees 7-1
Pre-Game Insights: Gerrit Cole (6-5) hadn’t allowed a hit and led 1-0 when he walked Devers with one out in the fourth.
Post-Match Reflections: “I felt like the first at-bat he hit him on purpose,” Red Sox manager Alex Cora said.
“He caught me by surprise,” Devers said through a translator.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Boston (75-74) closed within 3 1/2 games behind Minnesota for the last AL wild card.
New York (86-63) saw its AL East lead cut to two games over second-place Baltimore
